com.absio.database

Class DataAccess

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.absio.database.DataAccess

  • public class DataAccess
extends Object
    This class represents the data access for the database used in the OFSProvider to store all relevant data locally. It uses the Users, PublicKeys, Containers and Accesses tables.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataAccess

        public DataAccess(String location,
                  String hexEncodedAes256Key)
        Constructor with the DatabaseWrapper's location and hexEncodedAes256Key. This will set the version of the database to CURRENT_VERSION.
        Parameters:
        location - the file location of the DatabaseWrapper
        hexEncodedAes256Key - the hex encoded AES 256 key of the DatabaseWrapper

      • DataAccess

        public DataAccess(String location,
                  String hexEncodedAes256Key,
                  int version)
        Constructor with the DatabaseWrapper's location, hexEncodedAes256Key and version.
        Parameters:
        location - the file location of the DatabaseWrapper
        hexEncodedAes256Key - the hex encoded AES 256 key of the DatabaseWrapper
        version - the version of the database

    • Method Detail

      • closeDatabase

        public void closeDatabase()
                   throws SQLException
        If the database is open this will close the JDBC Connection.
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue closing the Connection

      • createStatement

        public Statement createStatement()
                          throws SQLException
        Creates a Statement using the JDBC Connection.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Returns:
        the Statement
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue creating the Statement

      • destroyDatabase

        public void destroyDatabase()
                     throws IOException,
                            SQLException
        This will close the JDBC Connection and then delete the database file.

        NOTE: the database file will be deleted and cannot be recovered!

        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there was an issue deleting the database file
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue closing the Connection

      • executeCountQueryWithParameters

        public long executeCountQueryWithParameters(ParameterizedSql parameterizedSql)
                                     throws SQLException
        This will execute the count query with the given parameters and return the result.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        parameterizedSql - the count query to run and the parameters for the query
        Returns:
        the count
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue executing the count query

      • executeUpdateWithParameters

        public int executeUpdateWithParameters(ParameterizedSql parameterizedSql)
                                throws SQLException
        The will execute the given sql as an update with the given parameters (insert, update, delete, etc).

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        parameterizedSql - the update sql to execute and the parameters to use in the execution
        Returns:
        the number of rows affected by the execution
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there is an issue executing the update

      • getVersion

        public int getVersion()
        Get the version of the database.
        Returns:
        the version of the database

      • openOrCreateDatabase

        public DatabaseOpenState openOrCreateDatabase()
                                       throws IOException,
                                              SQLException
        This will open or create the database. If opening the database the version number will be checked to see if an upgrade needs to happen. If creating the database all of the tables will be created.
        Returns:
        the open state of the database (new or open)
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown if there was an issue with the database location
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue creating or opening the database

      • prepareStatement

        public PreparedStatement prepareStatement(ParameterizedSql parameterizedSql)
                                   throws SQLException
        Create a PreparedStatement for the given sql and fill the parameters.

        NOTE: the database must be open before you call this method.

        Parameters:
        parameterizedSql - the sql to create a PreparedStatement with and the parameters to fill the statement with
        Returns:
        the PreparedStatement
        Throws:
        SQLException - thrown if there was an issue creating the PreparedStatement
